quick_answer.text: One scoop of vanilla ice cream has about 137 kcal, with 16 g carbs and 7 g fat.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Add chocolate syrup (1 tbsp per scoop)

faqs.q: How many calories in one scoop of vanilla ice cream?
faqs.a: Approximately 137 kcal for a standard 66 g scoop.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in one scoop of ice cream?
faqs.a: About 16 g total carbs, mostly from sugars (14 g).

faqs.q: Is ice cream high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, one scoop has 7 g fat, including 5 g saturated fat.

faqs.q: How does scoop size affect calories?
faqs.a: A larger scoop (e.g., 100 g) could add 50-70 more kcal; standard is 1/2 cup.

faqs.q: Are there low-calorie ice cream options?
faqs.a: Low-fat or no-sugar-added versions can reduce calories to 90-110 kcal per scoop.
